inn1.comm: going across Tharanga from a length, not much pace first up, and left alone easily
more pace on this one now from Lee, 134.7 kph, much fuller too, Tharanga is  not particularly to the pitch and pushes carefully to mid off
goes back of a length  now, so three different lengths in three deliveries from Lee, Tharanga keeps it down on the leg side and Lee rushes forward to field
Lee puts more effort in a shortish one, hits Tharanga hard on the bat as he pushes towards cover
pitched up and heading for off stump, 137.9 kph, Tharanga blocks with a straight bat, just a touch late in getting bat down
opens the bat face late and runs a back of a length ball around middle to point, nothing in terms of width from Lee
he is on target right away too, around that off stump, going across, Dilshan shuffles around and pushes towards point
more bounce as he goes back of a length, Dilshan pushes purposefully in front of cover with an open face and they take the first run of the game
Dougie gets the angle going, in the left-hander from short of a length, and he takes it on the body as he misses the work on the leg side
now he goes outside off stump, Dougie, and gets lots of bounce as it moves away from back of a length, Tharanga tried to go on the toes and cut but the bounce beat him
tharanga gets going with an inside edge, oh well, what's new you say, throws his bat from the crease at one close to off stump, but it goes fine on the leg side past the keeper
bit of away shape for Dougie, but this time Tharanga leaves outside off
shortish and he latches on to the pull right away, keeps it along the ground through square leg too, rolling his wrists over the ball
plays late, well done, allows the length ball to come in with the angle, and drops it towards midwicket
Dilshan looking for the swat-punch through extra cover, Lee bowls a slower one back of a length, and Dilshan cannot get any timing on the shot

well played, but Ponting at backward point rolls back the years with a dive to his left and a one-handed stop, Dilshan had used Lee's pace very well to open the face and push through the line, that was travelling
some width outside off but tharanga finds Ponting this time with the cut
even more width, and much fuller outside off, Tharanga eagerly goes on the front foot to bash it through extra cover but hits it back down the track as he gets too across
the ball is coming on nicely, but Dilshan's push finds short extra cover as he gets forward to a length ball going across
Doug is finding a lot of bounce from this harmless looking pitch, beats Dilshan who has a go at one leaving him with the angle
clobber! that is in Dilshan's slot, pitched up, wide and full outside off, he gets forward and cracks it off the middle through extra cover, bothering to run? don't
similar delivery, and Dilshan gets forward to thump it again, not that wide though, and he cannot time the shot, is pretty cross with himself and waves the bat in disgust
shortish delivery and Dilshan shapes up for the pull, he is late on the shot as Dougie finds some pace on it and hits it on the bounce to short midwicket
width available and Dilshan goes after it, thick outside edge but it has flown to the third man boundary
he is playing Lee with the angle as he comes from round the stumps, and works him towards square leg
looks to pounce on one just outside off stump but mistimes it towards covers
straight on middle stump, Dilshan pushes in front of mid on and takes off for the single
nast bouncer from Lee and he gives the look to Tharanga as well, angled in from wide of the crease, gets big on Tharanga and almost hits him near the throat, he just manages to get out of the way
well done, arching back and using the angle from a length to steer to third man
136.3 kph from Lee, and Dilshan goes pushing in the air off the front foot, ball falls short of the man at mid off, not quite driving length but he he had a go
tries to use the pace to guide a back of a length ball it wide of point but hits it straight to the man
beats him outside off stump, straightish one on a length, holding its line just a bit as Doug slows it down, Tharanga came forward but the lack of pace did him and he had a loose prod at it
worked on the leg side off the pads
they take on midwicket for the single, as there is a fumble there, and make it safely in the end as the throw from David Hussey is wide of the keeper

there is no getting away this time, Doug's bounce has done Dilshan, he has been getting it to take off consistently, Dilshan's instinct is to go after it as it bounces close to off stump, too high he finds out as he gets an edge on its way to Haddin

he has ducked right in to the bouncer, Doug is really troubling them with the short of a length balls, it did not get up outside off as much as Sanga expected and he rammed his helmet in to it as he got down, it went past the slip
in to the left-hander with the angle, and defended towards cover

Lee has gone through Tharanga, pretty ordinary shot and the stumps are splattered, it was the slower one from Lee, 125.3 kph, full and on the stumps, Tharanga just had a huge heave at it, and played all over it
solid defensive block from Mahela, as he shuffles across to a back of a length ball on off
uses the width and caresses the length ball past point from the crease
whoa, that was close, Mahela tried to get on top of a rising back of a length ball and run it towards third man, inside edge almost bowled him
carefully gets forward and defends one hurled in fuller from round the stumps close to off
slants it across Mahela from a length, it is just a touch wide outside off, and he lets it go
another one going across Mahela at 128.4 kph, that looked faster than that, Mahela shoulders arms
slowish one at 114.9 kph on middle, Mahela waits on the crease and twirls the blade to pick up a single on the leg side close to the pitch
on the pads from Doug with the angle and Sanga shuffles across to flick it to long leg, the Australians think there was something to it, it would have gone down leg
the short ball from Doug again, rises on Mahela who goes on his toes to keep it down, could do with a short leg probably
Mahela shows all his touch and class now, forward to a pitched up ball and caresses it past cover, lovely straight followthrough, no violence, no furious shuffling
right on off stump from a length, 137.1 kph, defended down the track
fuller on the pads and he flicks it neatly to deep square leg
now Mitch finds bounce from back of a length, it comes slowly off the track, and Mahela shuffles across and drops it fine on the leg side
confusion between the batsman, Sanga pushed towards extra cover and took off, Mahela followed, the both stopped mid way, and eventually got back
well down the pads as this one comes in a bit and he flicks behind square leg
gets forward and across, crouches and pushes past point
and starts off with a shortish one in to Sanga who pushes it towards mid on
trying to angle it across the left-hander, he gets forward and pushes back to the bowler
down the leg side but Sanga decides to put bat to it and sends it in front of square leg
slower one from Watto, 117.7 kph, it was full but Mahela seemed to pick it late and carefully patted it towards mid on in the end
easily done, uses the width outside off to open the face and run it wide of third man
gets forward and across to push towards mid on
just holding its line a bit around off stump, and Sanga gets forward to push it down the track
superb shot, moving away from a fuller length, and Sanga gets beside it and opens the face to squeeze it between cover and point
goes full for middle and leg, Sanga gets bat around pad to drive towards mid on
misfield at short extra cover who dives towards his right, gets a hand to it but lets it through, Sanga had cracked the drive off the front foot
pushed in to the off side off the front foot
bounces from back of a length, he opens the face to push towards point
and Ponting goes sprawling to his right at backward point to cut off the single, that would have been a super effort even from a man ten years younger
worked towards square leg for a single
nudged off the pads straight to short fine leg
well played, saw this one rising outside off, and glided it down to third man
hangs the bat outside off and opens the face to get it down to third man, Watson cutting it in from outside off
comes in with the angle, and Sanga pushes a touch inside the line to get a thickish edge to third man
solid straight-batted block from Sanga as he comes forward to a fullish one on off
moving away from back of a length and bouncing as well, he pushes towards point
tests him out with the bouncer, and Sanga goes down calmly under it
gets across and pushes firmly off the front foot but gets it straight to Mitch who fields in his followthrough
no room at all for Sanga on this one, right on a length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
arches back and guides a length ball past point for a single
allows it to come on and opens the face from close to the body to run it to third man
good delivery, coming in from a length on off stump, Mahela gets behind it to block
sees width outside off and tries to get the single to third man with a dab, and is beaten
the dab works for him this time as Watto gives lots of width outside off with the cutter, third man has some work to do
cuts in from outside off stump, but is a touch shortish and is slapped  away to sweeper cover
goes on the toes to keep a rising one down on the off side
well bowled, Mitch lets the near-yorker rip right on middle, not completely in the blockhole, and Sanga is able to dig it out
now the slower one, 121.1 kph outside off and he mistimes the push to mid on
tries the yorker again, but it goes screaming on the pads, he flicks well but on the bounce towards midwicket

fine shot, helped through square leg off the pads, that was travelling fast, but Lee the athlete comes bounding in from long leg, slides and gets body behind the ball, scoops it up to the man who has run in from deep midwicket
beats him now outside off stump with a slow cutter, Sanga early in to the shot
and gives it away last ball with one full on the pads, Sanga gets across and flicks it wristily to the long leg boundary
slides it full around middle and leg, pushed down the track
similar delivery, not much turn, pushed towards mid on
uses the angle to work behind square off the pads
turn from outside off this time, he uses it as he gets across and works through square leg
turn again from outside off, but is flat and shortish, and is cut in front of point
flat and turning in on off from a length, he goes back to push to the bowler, pretty tidy over first up
straight away around middle from a length, he carefully pushes it on the leg side
is squared up a tad, opens the face and steers one from close to the body past the man at wide slip, could be dangerous if it does not come off
arrests the forward movement to work one fired in with the angle on middle and leg to midwicket
getting up from back of a length, calmly chopped past point for a single
solidly forward to a length ball and blocks it towards mid off, holds the pose for an instant, high elbow, straight bat, click away
hangs the bat away from the body at a wide one, and gets it just past the man at wide slip, third man is squarish but he will get to it in the end
flattish one guided towards point from the crease
down the track, but almost yorks him as he gets too close to the pitch of a flighted one, Doherty fields as he manages to push it back in the air
gets the single to long on with a push with the turn
now Mahela gets forward and earns the single to long off with the turn
forward and works to midwicket
leaves the crease but doherty pushes it through quicker and he works it straight to midwicket again
hit on the body as Doug gets one to hold its line from back of a length, Mahela was getting forward to tackle the angle and missed the waft in the end
zippy delivery from short of a length, Mahela withdraws his bat, it is a touch widish and called a wide, Doug is not impressed
has him going on his toes to keep a back of a length ball down on the off side
fuller on the stumps this time, he cannot work it past midwicket
the angle takes the length delivery past Mahela who flags it through
this one did not get up much from short of a length, Mahela adjusted to work it on the leg side
gets forward to a fuller one and manages to clip it in front of square leg
shortish and outside off, arches back and cuts fiercely, to point
slowish one middle and leg, played out on the leg side
well bowled, tossed up and turning away full outside off, he goes for the drive away from the body, and it runs towards short third man
gets forward and pushes a length ball even as it bounces a tad, in front of cover
gets the single down to long off with the turn
down the track, he slows it down as he tosses it up outside off, and Sanga finds midwicket with the work
good delivery, Mahela goes poking at one leaving him outside off stump and tries to run it to third man, beaten
succeeds this time as he gets across and pushes from close to the body, single to third man
Sanga clips off the pads, in the air but past midwicket, and he will come back for the second to bring up yet another 50 stand between them
drops a length ball in front of square on the off side but cannot steal the single as a fielder is close by
bit of an inside edge as he gets forward to push at a length ball, the ball is not coming on as well now
gets well forward and opens the face to push straight to point
Mahela decides it is time, comes down the track as he sees mid on in the circle, takes on the flighted one on leg stump, and lofts against the turn, over midwicket
pushes a tossed up ball around off towards cover
more flight from Doherty, Mahela defends with a straight bat
quicker and flatter, he slashes to backward point
well run, a forward push past cover and it is wide enough to the man in the deep for them to come back for the second
fuller one pushed away to covers
Ponting at backward point has saved lots of runs today, and Sanga cannot push this one past him
slower and fuller one from Mitch around 128 kph, Sanga adjusts to push it down the pitch
Ponting lets one slip past him, and does not like that, got quickly to his left but the ball slipped past him off Sanga's push
hops in the air and fends a rising shortish one fine on the leg side
Mitch goes full on the pads in search of the yorker and Sanga whips him in front of square
straight on off stump from a length, Mahela carefully defends
angles it in full around off, and he comes forward to push to mid off
gets across, down the track and outside the line as Lee bends it in full, flicks him in front of square leg
high full toss from Lee now, he adjusts to push towards cover
straight and full one outside off, he gets forward and defends down the track, they are finding it difficult to work the ball away
lovely from Lee, moving away from short of a length on off stump, Mahela pushes inside the line and is beaten
has him forward and defending solidly to short extra cover to end an excellent over
chance for a run out, but Mike Hussey lobs it well over the stumps as he runs across and dives towards the ball at extra cover, Sanga had pushed a length ball and taken off right away
he has been a touch loose outside off today, Mitch pitched it up for the drive, Mahela goes at it only with the bat and not the feet, and does not make any contact

and again, floated wider and moving away further, Mahela moves across and goes for another drive, Haddin takes it diving to his right, Australia are sure there was an edge, umpire Asoka is equally sure there wasn't, Australia go for the review, the bat is nowhere near the ball, it was the sound of bat hitting ground but the ball was quite a few inches away
Mahela gets bat on ball now, shuffles well across and gets it off his hip fine down the leg side
too wide this time outside off stump, even Mahela in this want-to-drive mood won't go after that

dropped, what an over this has been, Mahela continues to go after full ones outside off, this time he gets an edge, but Haddin tumbles to his right, gets it in his gloves and it pops out, so a wasted review of a catch that wasn't and in the end a catch that almost was
pushed away on the off side solidly, Mahela is done with the adventures for this over
pushed through quicker down the leg side and Haddin cannot collect as he takes it on the right thumb
worked away through square leg

Sanga goes this time, he comes down the track, and does what he had been wanting to for quite some time, gets to the pitch and connects well with the lofted shot, but he has got it too flat and Lee takes a fine tumbling catch at long on, so Doherty breaks the stand for Australia, it had started to assume slightly worrisome proportions
pushed away on the off side, it was short and turning away, but he mistimed the cut

another one, Doherty strikes again, Silva has gone for nothing, pushing forward to one pitching on the off stump, it does not turn and goes on with the angle, he plays for it, outside the line as a result, is struck on the pads, and is given right away, that would have hit leg
flat one outside off stump, he cuts it off the back foot to sweeper cover
tossed up delivery pushed down the track
whips a fullish one off the pads wide enough of deep midwicket for a couple
finds some bounce from a length, he takes one hand off the bat handle as he fends it towards long leg
targetting the stumps with a fuller length, he gets across and pats it back
tries to lure Mahela with a length ball outside off, he just defends
he is giving Mahela a hard time, now the bouncer, it got on so quickly that it seemed headed for Mahela's head, but he got out of the way just in time
another short one, a touch down leg this time, Mahela awkwardly gets out of the way
forward and defends a fullish one down the track
bowling from wide of the crease and full around off, pushes on the off side for a single, the throw misses and the backing up is not the best

whoa, that is one of the blindest of blind charges you'll ever see, team four down, and Angelo comes rushing down the track as Doherty gives it a bit of air, he is nowhere close to it and is stranded way down the track, Haddin has a simple stumping
tossed up ball, patted down the track
bounces from a length, he goes back to push on the off side
slanted in full and he pushes it down the track carefully
fullish one whipped off the front foot wide of mid on, but he gets around to it
appeal for lbw, Watson gets it to move in late from a length, Mahela wasn't expecting so much movement and is caught unawares, could have gone down leg, replays show it would have just clipped leg
tight line around middle, he blocks with bat and pad together
back of a length delivery pushed on the off side
worked towards midwicket from the crease
Haddin puts in an appeal for lbw, but that was headed down the leg side and Mahela ensured it would disappear quicker by getting a little nudge on it
tossed up ball, he is doing that more now, pushed towards mid on
defended off the front foot on the off side
whoa, Kula decides to have a go and connects well, swings from middle and off against the turn, well there is not much from doherty and he gets it well over mid on
gets forward and smothers one full around off
had a look a one bowled slowly flat outside off, but let it go in the end
comes forward and pushes on the leg side
Watto fires it in the blockhole and Mahela can;t do anything but dig it out
pushes away from the body but goes softly at it and gets the full delivery past point
shortish, sitting up outside off and Kula punches to sweeper cover
slower one, Mahela opens the fact of the bat, there is a 36-year old at backward point who goes flying to his left, gets a hand to the ball but cannot stop it, is cross with himself, some standards
pushed away off the back foot on the leg side
almost played on, too close to the body and the off stump, Kula tries to chop it towards third man, inside edge on to pad saves him
uses the angle to work behind square off the pads
outside edge as he presses forward, but there is no one at slip and it goes towards short third man who fumbles and lets it through
well forward and smothers this one on the leg side
tossed up but on the pads and Mahela nudges it easily to long leg
flighted one blocked down the track
bowled fullish on off from wide of the crease, he gets forward to block
opens the face to push towards point
goes hard at a full delivery, and tries to put it through midwicket, mistimes it towards mid on
another one goes, Watson gets it to move in from a length, Kula is caught on the back foot, and the ball sneaks past his push to crash in to the pad and umpire Asoka has no issues with that
pushed solidly down the track as Watto sends down a gentle length ball on the stumps
pushes a slightly fuller one down the track again
goes for the one in the blockhole but he manages to dig it out, not much pace on it from Watson
bounce from a length as he tosses it up, Mahela presses forward to defend
fuller but Mahela smothers it easily down the track
sharp turn from outside off, Mahela withdraws the bat after having a poke at it
stretches well forward to smother a length ball
inside edge as this one goes on with the angle and Mahela pushes a tad outside the line
pushes forward to a quicker one and gets it past silly mid off
Mahela taking his chances with this one, gets forward and reaches out to pick it from outside off stump over mid on
fuller one slanted in and worked to midwicket
right on off stump from a length, Mahela presses forward to defend solidly
pushed down towards mid on off the front foot
cuts in from short of a length outside off, Mahela stays in the crease and plays it out on the off side
uses the angle and works it off the pads in front of square leg
Ponting gets some bad bounce at backward point as Mahela runs a length ball towards him, but he gets body behind the ball and is able to stop it
pushes a length ball wide of extra cover and gets through for the single
gives him the short ball, he awkwardly jabs it away on the leg side behind square
going across Mahela on a length, around off, and he comes forward to defend
chopped from the crease on the bounce to backward point
fine stroke from Mahela, he played a similar one at the start of his innings, forward to one going across and caresses it past extra cover, elegance all the way
and gets one first ball, Eranga tries to hop in the air and cut a bouncing short one outside off, picks out third man who does not have to move at all
coming in with the angle on off, Mahela defends carefully
low full toss at 128.1 kph, Mahela pats it away, extra caution coming in with all those wickets
that is a brute, that has taken off from short of a length, Mahela hops as he fends it away to third man, and refuses the single as No 9 comes jogging across
drives a pitched up delivery wide of sweeper cover and acknowledges the applause for a pain-staking 50
goes full but the angle takes it on the pads and he is clipped away through square leg
going straight on from a fuller length on off, blocked off the front foot
flighted full on leg stump, some turn this time, as Mahela defends
pushes a tossed up ball outside off away from the body in front of point
pushes a away a flat delivery towards point

is that another one, Prasanna goes for the review as umpire Hill gives him out leg before, it was the tossed up ball that carried straight in, he pushed outside the line and was struck on the pad, that would have hit middle and off, and Sri Lanka have lost the review, best figures for Xavier Doherty
tossed up invitingly but Malinga lets it go outside off
short of a length, Jayawardene is behind it in defence
nearly chips a low full toss down mid-on's throat. Doesn't make the best of connections, which is just as well
Binga! Accurate bouncer, Jayawardene looks for the flick-pull, gets a top edge, and Lee runs towards square leg to complete the catch. Huge wicket, Jayawardene could still have hurt Australia
right through him, backing away, Lee keeps it full, moving in late on the stumps, Malinga goes nowhere with the swipe and that is the end of the innings

inn2.comm: moving away a tad from a length, and Watson with that characteristic late chop down to third man
goes for the stumps with a fuller length, good delivery first up, he opens the face and gets it towards point
he is going for the yorker, ends up as a very low full toss, Marsh gets a bit of bat on it
full delivery, but he is able to get forward to it and push towards extra cover
Malinga rips the yorker at 140.7 kph on leg stump, Marsh gets front leg out of the way and manages to jab it away, almost falls over with the effort
length delivery this time on the middle stump, he is not getting forward understandably with all those grenades hurled full at him, plays it out carefully
almost through him first up, goes straight on quickly from a length, Watson late in getting forward and manages an inside edge
turns away a bit from off, he pushes with an open face to point
hurrying on at 86.9 kph, he backs away for the cut and is beaten
another one that almost goes through him, tossed up full on middle stump, turns in, but another inside edge saves Watson
he will put this one way, sitting up short outside off, and he cracks it in front of point
flighted right on middle stump, superb over apart from that boundary ball, Watson gets forward and defends on the off side
flighted  but full and very wide outside off, Marsh gets forward and puts it away through extra cover
beats him on the cut outside off with a flat and shortish one
this one will go, short again and sitting up, enough bounce on it for Marsh to rock back and time it past cover
pushed away on the off side
tosses it up on off stump and he gets forward to defend
pushes off the front foot towards cover
brutal from Watson, tosses it up, ends up as a low full toss, and Watson bashes it violently back towards the bowler, who does not attempt to grab at it, very wise choice
reaches well forward to push one away towards mid off
goes through Malinga at short third man, as Watson rocks back and thumps the cut off a short and flat one
dropped, guided straight to slip and goes right through his hands, it flew off the face of the bat, and got too quickly on to Mahela
pushed away on the leg side from a length
well left, floated up fullish outside off, but he lets it go
hurls a high full toss at Watson, dipped as it came on to Watson who hopped and kept it down on the leg side
defends a length ball as he comes forward
bit of width outside off and he sends it to third man with a quick flash of the hands
he is expecting the full delivery and is caught on the crease, but Malinga rips the bouncer outside off, and he withdraws the bat in the end
now comes the full delivery outside leg stump, he shuffles, gets bat around pad and works it to square leg
low dipping incoming full toss, he is clearly not finding it very comfortable against Malinga, adjusts late to jab it towards midwicket
short, flat and punched through the non-striker;s legs to long on
digs out a full delivery on the pads towards midwicket
turns away a bit from the left-hander as it is tossed up at an angle across him, he gets forward and shoulders arms
gets across and pushes solidly to covers
well done, sees this one flighted full on middle and leg, he shuffles forward, gets to the pitch and drives it softly past the bowler
worked on the leg side

Watson is gone, Malinga gets the breakthrough, got forward to power the drive down the ground off a length delivery around middle, that is not on on this slow pitch, it bounces, hits the bat high and mid on accepts the dolly
goes fullish on the off stump, Ponting shuffles well across and keeps it out on the leg side
slower and much fuller, patted back to the bowler

almost a run-out, Ponting purposefully comes forward, pushes to extra cover and takes another step out, that is enough hint for Marsh who takes off in a blaze, but has to turn back half-way up the track and get back in time as the throw comes in

they have the big one, the full toss has worked for Malinga, Ponting shuffles far across and tries to punch it away in the air, gets it front of square leg where the man takes an excellent diving catch, game on? Certainly
oh he almost bowled him, Malinga knows it and smiles, the slowish yorker first up, but Clarke manages to keep it out, barely
and is put away behind square leg first ball, on the pads and Marsh flicks it neatly
better from Kula, pitched up and going across the left-hander, who gets an inside edge as he presses forward, a touch late
pushes off the back foot towards mid on
short, wide and that has been put away by Marsh, got on top of it and crashed it in front of cover, not timed that well but enough to beat the fielder
moving away from a length on middle, well bowled, he defends awkwardly
pegging away with the angle across Marsh, a bit fuller and he pushes it towards cover
pitched up full just outside off, Clarke carefully opens the face and runs it to point
on a length and headed for middle and leg, he crouches and defends with extreme caution
lets the bouncer rip now, it comes out of nowhere after all those full deliveries, Clarke was not expecting it, and just managed to get his head under the line
pitched up now, he realises it late and gets forward to push it towards mid off
solid this time from Clarke, forward to a fullish one and drives it to mid off
tries to angle it in full around middle, but Clarke gets bat to it and pushes to mid on, Malinga has hands on his head
outside edge, but goes past the man at wide slip and beats third man running to his right as well, Marsh not getting well across to one leaving him outside off
pushes a length ball back to the bowler
straightish one on a length on middle, played out towards midwicket
puts front foot a long way down the track, and gets bat around it to defend
too much leg stump from Kula and he flicks to deep square leg
left alone outside the off stump
finds lots of bounce from a length on off stump as he angles it across the left-hander, he has a go at it but is beaten by the carry
now this one does not get up much as it pitches outside off and carries on with the angle, he is beaten on the cut this time
gets bat on ball this time and pushes a length ball to point
slower one at 112.9 kph down the pads and flicked through square leg, Clarke was late in coming back for the third and had the throw been on the stumps, he was in trouble
finds some bounce from just short of a length, he pushes it back to the bowler
shuffles and works it straight to short midwicket who turns and finds the non-striker;s stumps with a direct hit
tossed up full around off, blocked off the front foot
how's that for timing? tossed up full and wide, he gets to the pitch and carves it through extra cover, that just flew in to the boundary
pushed towards extra cover off the front foot
steady delivery full around middle, defended down the track
not much turn, he is just sliding them across, defended down the track
pushed away on the leg side
fine stroke from Clarke, busily get forward in to a firm push that just beats extra cover and earns him  a single
slanted across the left-hander, no need to play at it as he did in the previous over and got beaten, left alone this time
thickish outside edge as he pushes at a fuller one, goes towards point
gets across and keeps down a rising length ball around off
solid front foot push as he takes a step down the track, he is looking better now, mid off fields
watches one go across him outside off, he might have gone after that earlier but seems more at ease now
full delivery pushed down the track
Clarke down the track, takes it on the full and eases it towards extra cover
phew, what was that, that was unbelievable, that has pitched close to outside leg and just zipped across a bemused Clarke, the keeper takes it well outside off stump
have to hand it to Clarke, next ball after that snorter, he decides to abandon the crease, takes it on the half-volley and works it towards midwicket
nudged on the leg side for a single
drops it too short, and Clarke takes toll, rocks back and hammers the pull over midwicket
pushes a length ball on the off side and takes off for the single, an advancing mid off almost runs straight in to him, and has to leap over the stumps as he avoids Marsh, Dilshan it is
solid dead-bat from Clarke as he defends on the off side
comes in a long way from outside off on a length, he guides it from close to the body towards point
short, wide, skiddy delivery outside off, he goes after it with the slash and it flies over and past wide slip
almost gets in to trouble as he plonks front foot forward and across, this one comes in a long way from outside off, and he somehow manages to get it away towards square leg
moving away from a length on leg stump, he eases forward and presents a solid straight bat
down the track, takes a tossed up ball on the full, but cannot ease it past mid on
this time he will get it past mid on, comes down the track again, and lifts the half-volley over the bowler
backs away a shade to one pitching on leg stump, and pats it back to the bowler
forces him to drop short with all those charges, but cannot get the cut past backward point
takes it on the pad as he leaves the crease again and misses, but he was too far down the track for Sri Lanka's appeal to be upheld
pushed away on the off side off the front foot
flat straightish delivery on leg stump, played out towards square leg
he sprays it very wide outside off with a forward short leg in place
bit of an inside edge as he pushes forward to defend
fuller outside off, he gets forward to smother it
they are playing him out as much as possible, shortish but he just offers a dead-bat
tossed up, and he eases forward to pick the single to mid on with a push
turning away from the left-hander a shade around middle, right forward in defence, he has looked alright against Mendis
tossed up but a touch short and wide, Clarke's cut finds backward point again
goes deep in the crease to work the single wide of midwicket
that has disappeared, marginally short from Prasanna, and he rocks back to smash it over deep midwicket, almost takes out Percy, the long-time Sri Lankan supporter with it
even better, he comes down the track, gets to the pitch and caresses it past extra cover
pushed down the track off the front foot
flat one sliding across him, he stays in the crease to defend
tossed up full around off, he gets forward to block
full toss and Clarke forces it through midwicket, Marsh comes back and has to dive in to the crease, direct hit would have been interesting
playing very late as he stays in the crease to one tossed up outside off, allows it come on and dabs it past slip
squared up as this one turns away from leg stump, and the leading edge goes towards extra cover
very full one worked off the pads wide of midwicket
straightish on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
that will do, shortish and turning on the pads, Clarke swivels deep in the crease and swings it past the square leg umpire
another short one, outside off now, pushed past backward point
tossed up, pushed towards extra cover off the front foot
Marsh puts another one away, short and turning away, he goes back and cuts past point, brings up his 50 too, didn;t look convincing at the start but has looked comfortable against spin
pushed away from the crease
blocked off the front foot down the track
chips a sliddy flat delivery outside off towards point as he backs away for the cut
gets forward and across to block one outside off
turning away a bit from outside off, he gets forward, head on top of ball to block
looks to come down the track initially then stops and tries to work it off the pads, cannot get it away
dropped very tough chance, worked with the turn firmly straight to forward short leg, he could not hold on, it was Chamara
worked in to the leg side in front of square leg
slung on a length widish outside off, left alone watchfully
goes for the yorker, not full enough, he gets it away on the off side with an inside edge on to pad
low full toss now down the pads, and Marsh puts it wide of long leg
again on the pads from a full length, he shuffles and nudges it fine on the leg side
well bowled, slings it across the left-hander full close to off, has him pushing from the crease, and beats him with some late away movement
arrives the yorker on the stumps at 138.2 kph, Marsh shuffles about and keeps it out
meanwhile, clarke continues to use his feet but his bat cannot will the ball past midwicket
now he goes back in the crease and nudges square on the leg side
turning away from a length on off, he goes back and cuts it through point
tossed up but too full and Marsh eases it through extra cover, sweeper cover gets around to it in the end
punched off the back foot towards mid on
allows it to turn away from a length and pushes it past point
well done, opens the face and guides a yorker from outside off to third man, the man has grown in confidence alright
sprayed widish outside off stump and left alone

Sri Lanka go for the review, Malinga let the yorker rip on leg stump, and Clarke was hit on the pad as he missed the flick, not given, was that headed down leg, it is, looked like a no-ball as well in fact
goes for it again, he can produce them at will, Clarke manages a fortunate inside edge as he gets bat down
another one let loose full on the stumps, Marsh is squared up but gets it away towards point
he keeps coming at them without any let-up, but they keep digging out those yorkers, and near-yorkers, and low full tosses
short, sitting up and Marsh gets back quickly to pull it in to over midwicket
worked in the leg side for a couple
down the ground for another run to long on
punched off the back foot towards cover
hit on the pad outside leg as he tries to work a dipping tossed up delivery on the leg side, ball goes towards cover
pushed back down the track
pushed off the front foot towards mid off
uses the angle to work a back of a length ball in front of square leg
cuts one leaving him with the angle but straight to point
shuffles and nudges one off the pads behind square leg
tries the short ball, and he allows it go past him close to off, called wide for height
Clarke takes the slower and fuller one on, gets forward and lofts it cleanly over mid off
fires it in full around leg stump, Clarke flicks to midwicket
Prasanna gets his first ODI wicket, Marsh backs away and tries to dab one sliding flat across him towards third man, gets an edge on its way to Sanga
two in two for Prasanna and Sanga, Hussey is gone first ball, presses forward as this one turns away from him, and Sanga snaps up another edge
tossed up in to leg stump, pushed away to silly point off the front foot

three in four, that is a nothing shot, Hussey trying to cut off the back foot, one that was tossed up full on a length, it carries on to strike off stump, absolutely ordinary from Hussey, no way he can go back to that one
tossed up slowly on middle and leg stump, he comes forward to defend
drives a tossed up delivery to mid on, and brings to an end an over that Prasanna will never forget
coming in late and goes down the pads full, Clarke picks it away to long leg
almost sneaked through, tails in full on off stump with unfailing certainty, Haddin gets some bat on it, he was late in getting down on it
another yorker, a bowling machine could have deviated but not Malinga, on off stump and he digs it out
slings it full and wide, and Haddin goes after it, gets it high in the air but it clears the infield and trickles in to the deep cover boundary
eep, that was fired in and headed high and full for Haddin, but dipped on him late and he got it towards square leg off the thigh pad
full down the pads and he gets it away fine on the leg side, that will do for Australia
